results.title: Whale bait
results.brief_description: A whale’s strategy for dealing with fishing fleets and scientific research. The film makes a simple and effective statement on the struggle between man and nature.

results.title: Wet earth and warm people (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Candid glimpses of Indonesia and its people, in and around the capital, Jakarta. Following where chance leads, the film captures the flavour of life in this fertile crescent of tropical islands as it focuses on the Indonesian people caught between the past and the conflicting options of the future - to change or not to change from long-established patterns of life to ones more influenced by western technology. Awards: Melbourne, Atlanta, San Francisco and Toronto.

results.title: Westworld
results.creator_credit: Michael Crichton, Paul N Lazarus III and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Crichton, Paul N Lazarus III and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.description: Westworld combines solid entertainment and chilling topicality with a futuristic, suspenseful plot written by Michael Chrichton. Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines. Westworld is one of three giant theme parks built in what is left of America’s great outdoors where for $1,000 a day, tourists may indulge their highest and lowest appetites. Richard Benjamin and James Brolin are among the visitors to the futuristic theme park where the gun-hands and dance-hall girls are robots programmed to serve the guest’s whims and fantasises until something malfunctions in their circuitry. Yul Brynner delivers a remarkably eerie performance as a robot cowboy who develops a taste for the kill.
description_for_label: Westworld combines solid entertainment and chilling topicality with a futuristic, suspenseful plot written by Michael Chrichton. results.title: Westworld
results.brief_description: A dark odyssey about the dawn of artificial consciousness and the evolution of sin, set at the intersection of the near future and the reimagined past, Westworld explores a world in which every human appetite, noble or depraved, can be indulged.

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

results.title: Westworld
results.brief_description: In a futuristic resort, wealthy patrons can visit recreations of different time periods and experience their wildest fantasies with life-like robots. But when Richard Benjamin opts for the wild west, he gets more than he bargained for when a gunslinger robot goes berserk.

results.title: Westray
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan, Kent Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A moving account of the Westray coal mine disaster, which killed 26 men in Nova Scotia on May 9, 1992. Personal stories are brought to the screen in an innovative and dramatic style, tracing the stories of six people - three miners and three widows - whose lives were forever changed that day by a company that violated the most basic rules of mining safety. The film recreates the events that drew the workers to the high-tech mine, detailing the horror of the explosion and its complex and tragic aftermath. ‘Westray’ is a compelling portrait of working men and their wives that extends far beyond this particular mining disaster to highlight how the lives of working class people are often entrusted to companies that violate the most fundamental rules of safety and decency in the name of profit.

results.title: Westminster Abbey. - [Rev. version]
results.brief_description: This film is a revised version of “Westminster Abbey, Title Code 011796”. It traces the history of Westminster Abbey in relationship to its importance in the life of the English Church and nation and as a valuable record of the development of English eccleseastical architecture over the centuries. Musical score by Ecaro Pastore. Narration by Terence Alexander.

results.title: Westminster Abbey
results.brief_description: Westminster Abbey is the most famous Anglican church in the world. Periods of neglect and dissolution, as well as privilege and great ceremonial occasion have chequered its 900 year life. Here we are taken on a remarkable journey through history, visiting parts of the Abbey where the public never go, seeing priceless documents and books from the Abbey’s library and hearing from experts on its history. The result is an absorbing portrait of one of the finest Gothic cathedrals in Europe and a magnificent monument to a millennium.

results.title: Westminster Abbey
results.brief_description: The history of Westminster Abbey is the history of England. Here Parliament once met; here for centuries the Kings and Queens of England have been crowned; and here are buried illustrious Englishmen of all times - sovereigns, statesmen, poets, scientists, musicians. In the nave is the tomb of an Unknown Warrior, brought from Flanders in 1920 as representative of all the nameless British dead in the War of 1914-18. Westminster Abbey is a fine example of early English architecture. Concludes with scenes of the coronation of King George VIth. The film is accompanied by the Westminster Choir and the London Symphony Orchestra with original music composed and conducted by Horace Shepherd. Commentator: Alvar Lidell.
